primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in history to reverse social and economic hierarchies, restoring the marginalized to dignity and power.

tekstueel_bewijs: God raises the poor from the dust
God lifts the needy from the ash heap
God makes them sit with princes
God gives the barren woman a home
reordering the values of domestic life

zender.identificatie: The God of the Exodus / The God of the Gospel
tekstueel_bewijs: the God of the exodus liberation
the God of the Bible is always the same

ontvanger.identificatie: The poor, the needy, the barren (The Marginalized)
tekstueel_bewijs: the needy, the poor, the barren
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is challenged to identify with the Receiver, but often resists due to 'vested interest'.

tekstueel_bewijs: It is in Jesus that the Psalm... all converge
My life is about giving concreteness to God’s recovery
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Jesus is the historical manifestation/Helper of the Subject.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Settled World' / Vested Interests / Rival Gods
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the systemic status quo and the internal resistance of the comfortable hearer.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community's response of praise and 'signing on' to the revolution.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Praise is the 'sandwich' that responds to the primary action of God.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God of Exodus → Revolutionary Wholeness → The Marginalized

voorbeelden_god_subject: God would not let any of God’s precious children... be second-class citizens
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Likely you did not come to church as a revolutionary
we settle... for the world the way it is

voorbeelden: It would take practice to learn to sing this way
God wants the world to be otherwise
who among us wants the economy reordered?
ponder the truth of the God of the Gospel

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's sovereign power (Pouvoir) to change reality, rather than human obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the Ash Heap (~S2) to God's Action (S1), while exposing the hearer's preference for the Settled World (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'mercy of God' which invites the hearer into the new world despite their resistance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'settled world' is presented as a direct rival to God's kingdom.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor of the verbs of transformation. Human action is framed as a response (praise) rather than a condition.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Practice' to become a work
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It would take practice to learn to sing this way

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The words exhibit God as the prime mover
they found the world revised. And they credited that revision to God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Hannah and Mary are not used as moral examples to follow, but as witnesses to what God does.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: they are 'singers' of God's work.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Grace is shown as that which overcomes even the 'vested interests' of the hearer.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the ancient text to Jesus to the modern hearer is structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The clash between the hearer's comfort and God's revolution.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God is at work turning the world upside down... above all rival gods.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Father and Son; the Spirit's role in 'practice' is implied but not stated.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is seen as 'settling' for a world against the Gospel.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel excluded from the 'poor' who receive the benefit.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'wealthy/settled' also need the revolution to be freed from their 'vested interests'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explain *how* the revolution of Jesus specifically enables the 'practice' of this new life.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (our settled worlds) is well-defined.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's reversal) clearly precedes Ethics (our signing on).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in keeping God as the subject of the active verbs while addressing social reality.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'sandwich' metaphor; Greimas shows that the sandwich is actually a hierarchy of actants.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew; Greimas explains the 'engine' of the transformation described.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'danger' of the sermon lies in the Subject-switch from the hearer's autonomy to God's sovereignty.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism.
